revised_title: Pion-Nucleon Scattering and Excited Nucleon States: A Review of Phase Shift Analyses and Dispersion Relations
tldr: This article discusses the extensive phase shift analyses of pion-nucleon scattering and excited nucleon states conducted by the author and their collaborators. They explore the implications of these phase shifts and the use of partial wave dispersion relations in understanding the behavior of pion-nucleon interactions. The authors also analyze the contributions of various factors, such as rescattering, long-range, and short-range interactions, in their phase shift analysis.
